meanings.definition: Abnormal sensation, typically tingling or prickling, caused by pressure on or damage to peripheral nerves.
meanings.sent1: The paraesthesia in my hand felt like tiny ants crawling on my skin.
meanings.sent2: She experienced paraesthesia in her foot after sitting in an awkward position for too long.
meanings.sent3: The paraesthesia in my leg made it seem like I was walking on pins and needles!
meanings.sent4: The paraesthesia in his arm was like a silent alarm, warning him of potential nerve damage.
meanings.sent5: The paraesthesia was so intense, it felt like a thousand tiny needles pricking my skin.

meanings.definition: A sensation of tingling, tickling, pricking, or burning of a person's skin with no apparent long-term physical effect.
meanings.sent1: After the hike, she felt a strange paraesthesia on her sunburnt shoulders.
meanings.sent2: The paraesthesia on his back disappeared as quickly as it had come.
meanings.sent3: The paraesthesia on my neck was like a playful ghost tickling me!
meanings.sent4: Her paraesthesia was a reminder of the sun's harsh rays on her skin.
meanings.sent5: The paraesthesia felt like a warm, tingling blanket wrapping around me.
